snippet: The rapid fall of David Mamet’s new play, “The Anarchist,” raises questions about business on Broadway, especially the producer-playwright relationship.
abstract: Rapid fall of David Mamet’s new play, The Anarchist, raises questions about business on Broadway, especially the producer-playwright relationship; his track record lately on Broadway has been mixed; some playwrights criticize him for ponderous plays, but others say he remains important and original voice.
lead_paragraph: The rapid fall of David Mamet’s new play, “The Anarchist,” raises questions about business on Broadway, especially the producer-playwright relationship.

headline.seo: David Mamet Has Flop and Hit on One Broadway Block
headline.main: Behind a Flop, a Play(wright) Within a Play
headline.print_headline: Behind a Flop, A Play(wright) Within a Play
